oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Knoxville postmen
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Knoxville postmen outside the Post Office / Custom House, before 1918. (The building is now part of the East Tennessee History Center, Clinch Avenue, Knoxville, TN). Calloway Blanton ('Blant') Gossett is on second row, fourth from left. Erastus Gossett is on third row at right, in uniform.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Letter carriers; Group portraits; Post offices; Uniforms; African Americans;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Knox County Two Centuries Photograph Project
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: To use photographs or to order reproductions, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8808. Please refer to Image Number and provide a brief description of the photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
